definitions: The act of towing or the condition of being towed.
Something, such as a rope or chain, used for towing.
A vehicle or boat being towed.
The part of a shoe or boot that covers the toes.
The front part of the sole of a shoe or boot.
examples: He grabbed the tow and pulled the boat.
The tow was a small trailer.
She scuffed the tow of her boot.
The tow of his shoe was worn.
